name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Superficial erosion alone of bone/tooth socket by gingival primary is not sufficient to code as bone involvement.

**Note 2:**  Periosteum is a fibrous membrane that wraps the outer surface of bones. Cortical bone is the dense compact outer layer of the bone. Trabecular, cancellous, or spongy bone (spongiosa) is a porous network of tissue filling the interior of bone, decreasing weight and allowing room for blood vessels and marrow.

**Note 3:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size when involvement is limited to the cortical bone. Involvement through cortical bone is required for assignment of T4a. 

    Invasive tumor confined to lamina propria (mucoperiosteum) (stroma)

    Bone, NOS
    Buccal mucosa (inner cheek)
    Cartilage of mandible or maxilla
    Cartilage, NOS
    Cortical bone of mandible or maxilla
    Cortical bone, NOS
    Fascial muscle, NOS
    Floor of mouth
    Labial mucosa (inner lip), lower lip
    Labial mucosa (inner lip), lip, NOS
    Lateral pharyngeal wall
    Mandible, NOS
    Maxilla, NOS
    Soft palate including uvula
    Subcutaneous soft tissue of face
    Tongue mucosa
    Tonsillar pillars and fossae
    Tonsils
 
    Localized, NOS
rows:
(lip) Tumor invades through cortical bone, inferior alveolar
nerver, floor of mouth, or skin (chin or nodes)

(oral cavity) Tumor invades through cortical bone, into
deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue (genioglossus, hypoglossus,
palatoglossu, and styloglossus), maxillary sinus, or skin of
face

Deep (extrinsic) muscle of tongue:
    Genioglossus
    Hyoglossus
    Palatoglossus
    Styloglossus

Maxillary sinus (antrum)

Skin of face

Trabecular bone:      
    Mandible
    Maxilla
    Palatine bone

Stated as T4a

(lip and oral cavity) Tumor invades masticator space, 
pterygoid plates, or skull base, or encases internal carotid
artery

Specified bone

Masticator space
Pterygoid plates

Further contiguous extension including:
    Base of skull
    Internal carotid artery (encased)
    Skull

Stated as T4b

Unknown;  extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest
dimension
Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension
